name: Path T Gum Lower
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**  Superficial erosion alone of bone/tooth socket by gingival primary is not sufficient to code as bone involvement. (1)

**Note 2:**  Periosteum is a fibrous membrane that wraps the outer surface of bones. Cortical bone is the dense compact outer layer of the bone. Trabecular, cancellous, or spongy bone (spongiosa) is a porous network of tissue filling the interior of bone, decreasing weight and allowing room for blood vessels and marrow.

**Note 3:** Tumor size must be known to assign a value of T1, T2 or T3. You may use a physician’s statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record. 
* If the tumor appears to be in the T1, T2 or T3 categories, but no size or category is specified, assign TX

**Note 4:** Assign the appropriate T category (T1-T3) based on the tumor size when the tumor involvement is limited to the cortical bone for the following descriptions

    Invasive tumor confined to lamina propria (mucoperiosteum) (stroma)

    Bone, NOS
    Buccal mucosa (inner cheek)
    Cartilage of mandible or maxilla
    Cartilage, NOS
    Cortical bone of mandible or maxilla
    Cortical bone, NOS
    Fascial muscle, NOS
    Floor of mouth
    Labial mucosa (inner lip), lower lip
    Labial mucosa (inner lip), lip, NOS
    Lateral pharyngeal wall
    Mandible, NOS
    Maxilla, NOS
    Soft palate including uvula

    Confined to gum, NOS
    Localized, NOS

**Note 5:**  Involvement through cortical bone is required for assignment of T4a.
footnotes:
(1) International Union Against Cancer (UICC) *TNM Classification of Malignant Tumors,* 7th ed., Sobin, LH, Gospodarowicz, M, Wittekind, CH, eds. New York: Wiley, 2009, pg., 27

\* T4 [NOS] is not defined by UICC in the 7th edition. Approval has been provided by UICC to use "Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles" as T4 [NOS].
\# T4 [NOS] is not defined in AJCC 7th edition.
